newsitem.title: USA: Coram Healthcare sues Price Waterhouse.
newsitem.headline: Coram Healthcare sues Price Waterhouse.

text.p: Coram Healthcare Corp. said Tuesday it has sued Price Waterhouse LLP, alleging that the health care company's financial statements, as audited by Price Waterhouse, were inaccurate.
Coram, which provides patient care outside hospitals, is seeking damages of more than $165 million.

The lawsuit, filed in the Superior Court of San Francisco, followed the settlement of a lawsuit filed by Coram against Caremark Inc. and Caremark International Inc., under which Coram took on all of Caremark's claims against Price Waterhouse.
In announcing the earlier settlement July 1, Denver-based Coram said it would record a one-time pretax gain of $165 million in the second quarter.
"This assignment of claims includes claims for damages sustained by Caremark in defending and settling the lawsuit," Cormam said in a statement.
Caremark Inc. and Caremark International Inc. are both units of Medpartners Inc.
Price Waterhouse officials were not available to comment on the lawsuit Tuesday evening.
Coram stock rose 25 cents to $3.75 on the New York Stock Exchange.
